intro: Diapedium kurzii, commonly known as the Himalayan starwort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white or pink. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly hairy texture, adapting to the cold and harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Diapedium kurzii is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
